skill.name: geopandas
skill.description: Python library for working with geospatial vector data including shapefiles, GeoJSON, and GeoPackage files. Use when working with geographic data for spatial analysis, geometric operations, coordinate transformations, spatial joins, overlay operations, choropleth mapping, or any task involving reading/writing/analyzing vector geographic data. Supports PostGIS databases, interactive maps, and integration with matplotlib/folium/cartopy. Use for tasks like buffer analysis, spatial joins between datasets, dissolving boundaries, clipping data, calculating areas/distances, reprojecting coordinate systems, creating maps, or converting between spatial file formats.
skill.summary: Python library for working with geospatial vector data including shapefiles, GeoJSON, and GeoPackage...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and example code for GeoPandas usage. No credential access, network exfiltration, or execution hooks were found.

content.value_statement: Geospatial datasets are hard to join, project, and visualize consistently. This skill guides GeoPandas workflows for reading, analyzing, and mapping vector data.
actual_capabilities: Read vector files and filtered subsets with GeoPandas read_file
Reproject data and manage CRS with set_crs and to_crs
Run spatial joins, overlays, dissolves, and clipping operations
Apply geometric operations like buffer, simplify, centroid, and union
Create choropleth, layered, and interactive maps with explore
Write outputs to GeoPackage, GeoJSON, and PostGIS
limitations: Does not cover raster analysis workflows
Interactive maps require optional dependencies like folium
PostGIS operations require a configured database connection
Accurate area and distance need an appropriate projected CRS

use_cases.title: Measure zoning impacts
use_cases.description: Reproject parcels, calculate area changes, and summarize impacts by district.

use_cases.title: Join points to regions
use_cases.description: Spatially join event points to polygon regions and aggregate metrics.

use_cases.title: Build a map report
use_cases.description: Create choropleth and layered maps for a planning presentation.

prompt_templates.title: Load and preview
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner workflow to read a file
prompt_templates.prompt: Load a GeoPackage named parcels.gpkg, show the CRS, and display the first five rows.

prompt_templates.title: Reproject and measure
prompt_templates.prompt: Reproject my GeoDataFrame to EPSG:3857 and add an area_m2 column with polygon areas.

prompt_templates.title: Spatial join workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a spatial join of points to polygons using within, then aggregate counts per polygon.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-layer map
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a layered map with roads in red and parcels in light blue, and save it as map.png.

output_examples.input: Clip building footprints to the city boundary and export to GeoPackage.
output: Load boundary and footprints, align CRS if needed

best_practices: Check and match CRS before spatial joins or overlays
Use projected CRS for area and distance calculations
Filter data during read to improve performance
anti_patterns: Calculating area in geographic CRS like EPSG:4326
Loading entire datasets when a bbox filter would suffice

faq.question: Is this compatible with my GeoPandas version?
faq.answer: Examples use common GeoPandas APIs. Very old versions may lack some options like use_arrow.

faq.question: What data formats are supported?
faq.answer: Shapefile, GeoJSON, GeoPackage, Parquet, and PostGIS are covered in the examples.

faq.question: Can I integrate with PostGIS?
faq.answer: Yes, read_postgis and to_postgis are included with required database drivers.

faq.question: Does it access or send my data?
faq.answer: No, the skill is documentation only and does not perform data transfer.

faq.question: Why do I get CRS mismatch errors?
faq.answer: Reproject datasets to the same CRS before joins or overlays.

faq.question: How does it compare to plain pandas?
faq.answer: It adds geometry-aware operations and spatial indexing not available in pandas.
